meanings.definition: Not staying the same or not consistent.
meanings.sent1: The weather in this city is nonconstant, always changing from hot to cold.
meanings.sent2: Her mood was nonconstant, shifting rapidly from happy to sad.
meanings.sent3: The nonconstant bus schedule made it hard for commuters to plan their day.
meanings.sent4: The nonconstant flickering of the old street lamp gave the alley an eerie feel.
meanings.sent5: The nonconstant noise of the construction site was driving the neighbors crazy.

meanings.sent1: The colors of the leaves in autumn are nonconstant, turning from green to red.
meanings.sent2: His interests are nonconstant, always shifting from one hobby to another.
meanings.sent3: The nonconstant speed of the snail race kept the audience on their toes.
meanings.sent4: The nonconstant flow of the river mirrored the ups and downs of life.
meanings.sent5: The nonconstant melody of the wind chimes soothed her restless mind.

meanings.sent1: The nonconstant supply of fresh vegetables made meal planning challenging.
meanings.sent2: Her sleep pattern was nonconstant, often interrupted by nightmares.
meanings.sent3: The nonconstant buzzing of the faulty light bulb was like a persistent mosquito.
meanings.sent4: The nonconstant rhythm of the drum added an unpredictable element to the music.
meanings.sent5: The nonconstant flow of customers in the store kept the staff on their toes.
